metadata.feature_description: Filter activity stream by various criteria and activity types

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Filter by activity type - Added to Wiki

steps.action: Navigate to Community page with Activity Stream
steps.expected: Activity Stream is displayed with filter dropdown
steps.actual: Activity Stream displayed with 'Filter by activity' dropdown visible

steps.action: Open the filter dropdown and view available options
steps.expected: Filter dropdown shows various activity types
steps.actual: Dropdown shows options including Posts, Links, Photos, Files, Forum Topics, Added to Wiki, etc.

steps.action: Select 'Added to Wiki' from the filter dropdown
steps.expected: Activity stream filters to show only wiki-related activities
steps.actual: Activity stream filtered to show wiki article entries (e.g., 'authored wiki article Test Article with Special Chars')

steps.expected: Activity stream filters to show only post activities
steps.actual: Activity stream filtered to show only user posts (text posts without wiki/badge/privilege activities)

steps.action: Select 'Filter by activity' (default option) from the dropdown
steps.expected: Filter is cleared and all activities are shown
steps.actual: Activity stream shows all types of activities including posts, wiki entries, badges, and privileges

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Save filter preferences - Create custom filter

steps.action: Click 'Create New Feed' link in Activity Stream Filter section
steps.actual: Filter Builder dialog opened with fields for Feed Name, Authors, Groups, and Activity Types

steps.action: Enter 'Test Wiki Filter' as feed name and select 'Added to Wiki' activity type
steps.actual: Feed name entered and Added to Wiki checkbox selected with visual checkmark indicator

steps.action: Click Save button to save the filter
steps.expected: Filter is saved and appears in the filter list
steps.actual: Filter saved successfully, 'Test Wiki Filter' now appears in the Activity Stream Filter list with edit icon

steps.action: Click on the saved 'Test Wiki Filter' in the filter list
steps.expected: The saved filter is applied and activity stream is filtered accordingly
steps.actual: Filter applied, activity stream now shows wiki-related activities matching the filter criteria

steps.action: Click the edit icon next to 'Test Wiki Filter'
steps.expected: Filter Builder dialog opens with saved filter values populated
steps.actual: Filter Builder dialog opened showing Feed Name 'Test Wiki Filter' and 'Added to Wiki' activity type pre-selected

steps.action: Click Delete button in the edit filter dialog
steps.expected: Filter is deleted and removed from the filter list
steps.actual: Filter deleted successfully, 'Test Wiki Filter' no longer appears in the Activity Stream Filter list

steps.action: Create a new filter 'Persistence Test Filter' and apply it
steps.actual: Filter created and applied, showing empty results (no matching activities for filter criteria)

steps.expected: Saved filter 'Persistence Test Filter' should still be present in the filter list
steps.actual: Persistence Test Filter is still visible in the Activity Stream Filter section, confirming filter persistence

observations: Filter by date range is NOT available in the UI or codebase. The code only supports filtering by Author (user), Group, and Activity Type (journalType).

Filter by user and Filter by group functionality exists in the Custom Feed Builder dialog with autocomplete input fields, but was not explicitly tested as separate scenarios since they use the same mechanism as activity type filtering.
Apply multiple filters is inherently supported - the Custom Feed Builder allows selecting multiple Authors, Groups, and Activity Types simultaneously.

The dropdown filter ('Filter by activity') and Custom Feed Builder are two separate filtering mechanisms - dropdown for quick single-type filtering, Custom Feed Builder for complex multi-criteria saved filters.
Filter validation requires a Filter Name - empty name shows validation error 'Activity Feed Name Required'.
